runs.comm: and he beats a very flat-footed Kieswetter first ball...was quite some way outside off stump and he just pushed at it

gone! Two balls is all it took. A horrid hack from Kieswetter which loops in the air to point...was short of a length, we went for the pull but wasn't in a great position and the ball flew straight up

gone! First ball! Wright fends outside off and sends the ball to slip...short of a length outside off, Wright didn't know whether to play or leave and in the end the ball ran off the face to Chris Gayle
short of a length again outside off, shapes away a touch and left alone...wow, what a start to this innings
outside off, Bairstow gets behind the line and pushes back to the bowler
hint of width outside off, cut firmly but straight to cover...a wonderful start by Rampaul
tossed up full, driven firmly towards mid-off
onto the front foot, drives with an open face to cover
gets beaten as he tries to cut a delivery that skids through outside off
dragged a fraction shorter, it sits up a little more but Bairstow can only find cover
driven out to cover who fumbles and it allows Bairstow to get off the strike
tight to the stumps, Hales gives himself a touch of room and chops to backward point
short outside off, Bairstow goes for the pull and mistimes it towards mid-on
this time he connects with the pull and sends it powerful wide of mid-on
fuller on off stump, punched into the off side
backs to leg to give himself room into the off side, slaps the ball towards mid-off and he would have been out with a direct hit by Dwayne Bravo
edged! Hales goes for the drive, it takes the inside edge but doesn't carry to Ramdin who gets one glove on it
touch short from Rampaul, Bairstow is quickly onto the pull but midwicket has been reinforced and he picks out the man
beaten as he tries to cut...Badree a skiddy spinnner
nicely played, he met this with a full face of the bat (revolutionary idea, I know) and drives elegantly between cover and mid-off
now he steps to leg against a short ball and cuts this past a diving Gayle at short third-man for consecutive boundaries
touch fuller, on off stump, Hales punches off the back foot to cover
full on leg stump, worked down the ground to long on
beats the top edge again, another attempt to cut a ball that hurries the batsman
a touch short, Hales on the back foot tucks him through midwicket
tossed up slowly, Bairstow uses his feet and pushes towards mid-off and sets off for another tight run but mid-off can't collect cleanly
cuts in the air but it goes fine of short third-man and beats him over a quick outfield...just a fraction short, but it as was almost a catch
down the track, Narine bowls it shorter and Hales misses out
neat footwork from Hales gets him to the pitch and flicks it through midwicket
tries to pull but gets cramped for room and can't find much timing as it dribbles into the leg side
full outside leg, flicked through the leg side and there's some good running to make that a second
tries to give himself room and the ball scoots past leg stump into Ramdin's pads
pushed quickly outside leg stump but Bairstow can't get his sweep away as he gets struck on the pads
quicker ball on leg stump, Bairstow works it away off a thick inside edge towards square leg
fired down the leg side, appeal for a catch and no wide given so it must have come off pad
cut firmly into the off side and can't pierce the field
full on off stump, not much pace to work with, Hales pushes into the off side
a little shorter, Hales onto the back foot and opens the face to backward point
much needed by England, Hales latches onto a short ball and pulls it over deep square-leg...wasn't miles away from the fielder
now he punches a full ball down the ground towards long-on and Bairstow hurries back for the second...needed to be sharp
pushed off the back foot again, this time towards mid-off
well played by Bairstow as he brings out the paddle/flick over his shoulder...he took it from outside off and sent it over short fine-leg
dragged down a touch short outside off and well put away by Hales as he drives square to beat backward point
missed stumping as Hales gets beaten on the inside edge and then there could have been a run out as well. Chaos.
goes for the sweep, an appeal for lbw but it's going down leg
slow on leg stump and takes the pad
steps to leg and exposes all his stumps as he drives this past a diving cover to the sweeper
down the pitch, doesn't make contact and ends up kicking it to the leg side and there's no single as Badree is quick in his follow through
slower and short outside off, cut away through the off side to the sweeper
loops up off the surface and Bairstow misses his cut
extra width this time, Bairstow cuts again but it only costs a single to the deep
sharp turn on this one, Hales didn't pick that as he ends up padding it away
fetches from outside off stump with a sweep which goes in front of square to deep midwicket
fuller and a little flatter, chopped to short third man and it's a cheap over from Narine
fired in full at leg stump and Gayle fields himself
same again, Bairstow is really struggling and can only jab the ball away
heaved away quite ungainly through the leg side, a lot of effort to only get a single to deep square
a little more air this time, drilled firmly down the pitch but straight at Gayle...excellent stuff
uses his feet, a very full ball which he can only squeeze square to point

wonderful catch! Bairstow trying to hit straight and he wasn't far from clearing the boundary but Pollard raced around from long-on and timed it perfectly with a full stretch to pluck in the catch. Slick from West Indies
round the wicket, slung down on a length, goes back and chops through point to get off the mark
pushed through flat on off stump, Hales gets a low leading edge back to the bowler
touch short this time, wide of the stumps and steered through gully for a couple
Hales advances, fired down the leg side - that''s a wide but also a missed stumping chance, though Ramdin was unsighted and nowhere near taking it
length ball tossed up outside off, forward and then back, slaps a couple through point
quick and flat and on off stump, blocked
low full toss from Samuels, Morgan swings like Babe Ruth and slices four low past short third man on the edge of the circle
length ball floated up outside off, goes back and pats straight to extra-cover
low full toss on leg stump, worked through midwicket and the fielder on the rope has to run round, they get two
tossed up outside the line of off, pushed through the covers
bit of flight, on the stumps and Morgan steps out, gets to the pitch and drives through extra-cover
full and flat outside off, swiped low through cover-point, hit hard but straight to the man on the fence
round the wicket, floated up on the stumps, Morgan reverses the hands but can't beat the infield
floated up outside off, hacks to point and a misfield gives them one
tossed up and Hales steps out to drive punchily down the ground, it was in the air but hit flat and beats the dive of long-off
even better this time, length ball, rocks back and smites a cross-batted six over deep midwicket, that had some gas behind it
full and pushed through outside off, punched to cover
worked off the pads in front of the man at deep midwicket for a couple
fired in full on leg stump and dug out behind square
on the stumps, pushed back down the ground
bit of width, slashed through point
wide of off stump and squirted along the ground through the covers
full length, on the stumps, Morgan tries to clear the front foot but doesn't connect with a big swing of the bat
ah, that's gone, low full toss and Morgan skyscrapers it way over deep square leg with a swish of those forearms
full bunger, on the stumps and worked round the corner for one
flighted outside off, gets out and works a couple between long-on and deep midwicket
floated up and reversed to short third man
looped up wide of off ... too wide, as Hales reaches and misses
tossed up on the stumps, no pace on the ball and Hales slog-sweep loops into a gap at midwicket
leaves the crease and pushes a single back past the bowler
tossed up outside off, full-blooded mow and that's gooooooooooooone all the way over long-off
steps out again and drives a full-length ball down the ground to long-off
fired in, Morgan slog-scoops out towards wide long-on, it's taken on the bounce and then Hales has to scramble back after trying for a second, just making his ground as Ramdin breaks the stumps
pushed through, played back down the ground
tossed up on the stumps and bunted out to wide long-on where Dwayne Bravo dives over the ball in a spirit of generosity
tossed up outside off, goes down on one knee and swept through backward square
pushed through outside the line of off, goes back and slaps on to deep point
top-edged but it goes over the keeper and lands between short third man and short fine leg as they converge!
length ball, swipes across the line and manages another top-edge over the keeper for one to fine third man
pitched up and clipped through square leg for another single
another top edge ... but this one goes for six! He swatted across the line again and the ball ballooned all the way over fine leg

Morgan gets hold of this one too, hoicking the ball high into the sky on the leg side ... it looks six all the way but a fantastic leap from Andre Russell prevents six! That is astonishing, he launched himself into the air and as he flew back over the boundary rope, cushioned the ball and popped it back into play before hitting the ground. He then got back on his feet to throw the ball in!
ah, impudent stuff from Morgan, saw fine leg was up and stepped across to ramp the ball over the infield and away for four
pitched up on the stumps, punched down the ground
floated up on the stumps, paddled through midwicket by Morgan and that's a half-century that seems to have arrived by stealth
floated up, Hales advances but can only drag the ball down on to the ground through midwicket, though they get back for a second
punched back down the ground for one
reverses the grip and that's another top edge from Morgan ... and it lands safe, in the region backward point, the two fielders then colliding with each other as they rush to collect the ball!
carrom ball, spears this down the leg side - wide
floated up on the stumps, Morgan swipes busily across the line but the ball merely gets trapped between his knee flap and thigh
length ball, carved away over midwicket and it looks like it's screaming to the boundary but Darren Sammy tears after it to keep the damage to three
pitched up and angled across, Morgan takes a step out and opens another can of whupass on Rampaul, battering a straight hit over long-off
back of a length, maybe a slight change of pace and Morgan, who seemed to be expecting something else, swings across the line and misses
full and straight and in the slot - that's gone miles! Morgan cleared the front leg, swung his arms through a clean slog that sails way over deep midwicket
goes round the wicket now, full and wide of the stumps, dug out to mid-off and they scamper one, in fact there's a chance of an overthrow but Morgan had run on too far
Rampaul holds his nerve, full and wide and Hales swishes airily, fails to connect and that's a precious dot
full length outside off and crumped down the ground, Pollard hares round from long-off but can only tip the ball further on to the rope for four
dot ball! Full and speared into the slot, hacked back to the bowler
angled across towards off stump, Morgan can't get underneath the ball and bunts a single into the off side
got him, that will settle it! Hales advanced, Samuels fired it it full and wide, the batsman dragged his bat down but missed, was a yard or two out and Ramdin applied the coup
full, flat and on the stumps, clipped through backward square leg for a solitary, sorry one
pitched up again, pretty much medium pace now, dug out low to deep backward point - that's it, West Indies have won by 15 runs
